titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the South Brooklyn Presbyterian Church membership roll 1986.038
titlestmt.author: Matthew Gorham
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was originally processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-08-09 20:05:12 +0000.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.unittitle: South Brooklyn Presbyterian Church membership roll
did.abstract: This collection consists of one bound volume: a membership roll from the South Brooklyn Presbyterian Church, dated 1842 to 1874.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection consists of a single volume.

bioghist.head: Historical note
bioghist.p: The South Brooklyn Presbyterian Church (also known as the South Presbyterian Church) was organized in 1842. The church edifice was completed at the corner of Clinton and Amity Streets in Brooklyn Heights in 1845. In 1875, the church was consolidated with the First Presbyterian Church and became known as the Clinton Street Presbyterian Church.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: South Brooklyn Presbyterian Church membership roll, 1842-1874, 1986.038; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was rehoused and the finding aid revised by Dee Bowers in 2024.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection consist of one bound volume: a membership roll from the South Brooklyn Presbyterian Church, dated 1842 to 1874.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: This item is in the public domain.
